topic.title: Adding Integration with your Favorite Search Engine

keywords.keyword: Adding Integration with your Favorite Search Engine

para.text: Adding Integration with your Favorite Search Engine

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.text: RSS Bandit supports integration with a wide variety of search engines for searching the web. The default installation includes
. Some search engines (such as Feedster) can return results as as RSS feed, which RSS Bandit displays in a special

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: To use search, simply enter a phrase in the search bar and click on the icon with the magnifying glass over the globe (see figure 1).

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: This will search the web for the phrase you entered using your default search engine(s) by opening a separate Document Tab for each of the default engines. Click on the little down arrow next to the globe to select a different search engine (figure 2). This will initiate a search with that search engine only:

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: To change the order of the search engines, or to add or remove a search engine, go to

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: tab. It should bring up the dialog shown in figure 3.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The default search engines are all engines, that have the checkbox checked on. Engines with a unchecked setting are

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: included in your default search (a click on the icon with the magnifying glass over the globe).
You can reorder the search engines by selecting an engine and clicking

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: . To add a new search engine, click the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: button. This will bring up the properties dialog for a search engine as in figure 4.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: field requires the URL for the search engine. Note that the URL cannot simply be the URL to the front page of the search engine's web site. For example, you cannot simply enter

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: . In order for RSS Bandit to integrate with the search engine, it needs to communicate the phrase you wish to search to it. Most search engines have some facility for communicating the search phrase via the query string.
For example, to search for "RSS Bandit" with Google, you can use the following URL:

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:underline; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: When adding the URL to the search engine, use "{0}" (sans quotes) where the search term belongs. If you look at the properties for the Google search engine, you'll see that the URL is

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: Every search engine is different, so you'll have to check with the search engine. The search URL is expanded with the search term you provided and escaped before it gets send to the target address.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: field is the text displayed in the list of search engines (as seen in figure 2).

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: field is used to provide extra information when viewing the list of search engines within the Options dialog (as seen in figure 3). This is not displayed elsewhere.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: field allows you to browse for a 16 x 16 pixel image or icon that will represent the search engine. It will be displayed next to search engine as in the hastily created icon for Yahoo in figure 5.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Figure 5: Yahoo now has an icon.
If the search engine returns results as RSS, check the checkbox labeled

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: Search result will be returned as RSS
. This will place the results within the special

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: Merge the resultset with items returned by a local search
to have the search result folder also contain results from a local search.
